Simulate functions from an integrated Wiener process prior

Source: R/04_fash.R
simulate_IWP.Rd

This internal helper simulates sample paths from an integrated Wiener process (IWP)–type prior using a spline basis plus a low-order global polynomial trend. The spline coefficients are drawn from a multivariate normal distribution with a precision matrix constructed from the knot locations, scaled to achieve a target predictive standard deviation (PSD). The global polynomial coefficients are drawn independently from a normal prior.

simulate_IWP(
  n_samps = 1,
  n_basis = 20,
  psd = 1,
  sd_poly = 0.1,
  p = 1,
  pred_step = 1,
  x_range = NULL,
  x_new = NULL
)

Arguments

n_samps

Integer; number of function samples to draw.

n_basis

Integer; number of spline basis functions (i.e., number of knots). Must be at least 3.

psd

Numeric; target predictive standard deviation (PSD) for the IWP component, on the scale implied by pred_step.

sd_poly

Numeric; standard deviation for the global polynomial coefficients.

p

Integer; order of the integrated Wiener process / local polynomial.

pred_step

Numeric; prediction step size used in the PSD scaling formula.

x_range

Numeric vector of length 2 giving the range of the input domain [x_min, x_max]. If NULL, defaults to c(0, 10). Used to construct the knot locations.

x_new

Optional numeric vector giving the evaluation points at which the sampled functions should be returned. If NULL, 100 equally spaced points over x_range are used.

Value

A list with elements:

samples

A numeric matrix of dimension length(x_new) × n_samps containing the simulated function values. Each column corresponds to one function sample, and each row corresponds to an evaluation point in x_new.

x_new

The numeric vector of evaluation points at which the functions are simulated.

Details

The function constructs a spline basis over x_range using n_basis knots, and a global polynomial design of order p over x_new. Spline coefficients are sampled from a multivariate normal distribution with precision matrix $$Q = \frac{1}{\sigma^2} Q_{\text{IWP}}(knots),$$ where Q_IWP is computed by compute_weights_precision_helper() and sigma is chosen so that the resulting process has predictive standard deviation approximately equal to psd at step size pred_step. The global polynomial coefficients are sampled independently from \(N(0, \text{sd\_poly}^2)\).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  sim <- simulate_IWP(n_samps = 5, n_basis = 20, psd = 1, p = 2)
  # Each column is a sample
  matplot(sim$x_new, sim$samples, type = "l", lty = 1,
          xlab = "x", ylab = "Sampled function")
} # }
